The claim originated from the website W2: which is known for publishing false claims and has a history of spreading misinformation.
The Minnesota Department of Public Safet: specifically John Harrington, the commissioner, stated that there was no announcement or confirmation of Derek Chauvin committing suicide in his prison cell.
Legitimate news outlets: including Minneapolis CBS affiliate WCCO-TV, did not report on Chauvin's suicide. The claim was only propagated by the unreliable source, W24 news.
Derek Chauvin was being held in Hennepin: Oak Park Heights, indicating that he was not in a position to commit suicide.
